body_html: The warning is logged when _PerGraphState is being serialized. This happens if it's left as part of the graph collection. That shouldn't happen due to the TowerOptimizer._clear_graph_state() call. There is some unit-test coverage of this behavior. Are you doing something unusual with the graph, the collections or not using TowerOptimizer?
body_text: The warning is logged when _PerGraphState is being serialized.  This happens if it's left as part of the graph collection.  That shouldn't happen due to the TowerOptimizer._clear_graph_state() call.  There is some unit-test coverage of this behavior.  Are you doing something unusual with the graph, the collections or not using TowerOptimizer?
body: The warning is logged when _PerGraphState is being serialized.  This happens if it's left as part of the graph collection.  That shouldn't happen due to the `TowerOptimizer._clear_graph_state()` call.  There is some unit-test coverage of this behavior.  Are you doing something unusual with the graph, the collections or not using TowerOptimizer?
